Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The dyskinesias were reduced predominantly in the lower limbs during the onset and disappearance of dystonic dyskinesias ( onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias ) and in the upper limbs during choreic mid - dose dyskinesias .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| dyskinesias |
| dystonic dyskinesias |
| onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias |
| choreic mid - dose dyskinesias |

In this paragraph, the "Disease" entities refer to various types of dyskinesias, which are movement disorders. The specific types mentioned are dystonic dyskinesias, onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias, and choreic mid - dose dyskinesias.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The dyskinesias were reduced predominantly in the lower limbs during the onset and disappearance of dystonic dyskinesias ( onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias ) and in the upper limbs during choreic mid - dose dyskinesias .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias |

Note: The term "onset - and end - of - dose dyskinesias" is the only chemical-related term in the paragraph. It refers to a condition where abnormal involuntary movements occur at the beginning and end of a dose of medication, typically used to treat Parkinson's disease.
